page.title: 03 FENDER VALLEY FARM
page.content:
Fender valley is a farm that is over 400 years old.It occupies 150 acres.
They keep 45 horses and 48 cattle.They feed the horses and cattle on oats,barley,wheat,hay,maize and straw.Sometimes they will add vitamins to their diet.Since the start of this year only one foal has been born because the mares wouldn't reproduce.
Nine people live and work at the farm and they produce some crops.There is an 80 foot deep well.The water is still drinkable and is pumped out during water shortages.
The farmland is very low lying and marshy and really not suited to growing crops, being too wet. The farm makes money by giving riding lessons for Â£1.50 an hour.
